title.narrative: 3.1 IMPROVED ACCESS TO SAFE DRINKG WATER

description.narrative: Output 3.1: By 2018, communities, schools and health facilities in the most-at-risk geographic areas have improved, sustainable access to safe drinking water and sanitation, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By 2018, children, in particular the most vulnerable, have access to improved water sources and adequate sanitation facilities in schools, health centers and communities to prevent diseases, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.1: By 2018, communities, schools and health facilities in the most-at-risk geographic areas have improved, sustainableaccess to safe drinking water and sanitation

description.narrative: In 2018, based on the technical and feasibility studies conducted in 2017, one multi-villages piped system was constructed and 16 communities, 34 schools and five health centres were connected, including to the existing piped systems, permitting 20,609 people and 11,136 pupils gain a sustainable access to safe drinking water. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019
